statement: Brian Kemp and Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger “perhaps in collusion with the Radical Left Democrats” are attempting to “unseat” U.S. Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene.

statement: Democrats “are trying to ban voter ID.”

statement: “There were no guns whatsoever” at the Capitol riot on Jan. 6.

statement: “In 2020 we won (Wisconsin).”

statement: Says Republican leaders “are working hard to cover up election corruption in Wisconsin.”

author: Amy Sherman
statement: “Facts have now come out to show conclusively” that the 2020 presidential election wasn’t legitimate.

statement: Georgia didn’t update its voter rolls prior to the 2020 presidential election; “this means we (you!) won the presidential election in Georgia.”

statement: “Republican state senators” who started an audit of 2020 election results in Maricopa County are “exposing this fraud.”

statement: "The entire Database of Maricopa County in Arizona has been DELETED!"

statement: “Human trafficking and drugs” at the Mexico border have “doubled, tripled and quadrupled” since Joe Biden became president.

statement: Says Deborah Birx “traveled a great distance to see her family for Thanksgiving, only to have them call the police and turn her in. She then ... resigned.”

statement: "We proudly handed the Biden administration the most secure border in history. All they had to do was keep this smooth-running system on autopilot.”

statement: HR 1 “automatically registers every welfare recipient to vote.”

statement: Says Joe Biden has plans to ban animal agriculture and gas-powered cars.

statement: "We won. We won in a landslide. This was a landslide.”

statement: “You had (4,925) out-of-state voters… in Georgia.”

statement: After a “major water main break,” Georgia election workers counted “18,000 ballots, all for Biden” that they pulled from suitcases and with no election observers present.

statement: “We won Georgia easily. We won it by hundreds of thousands of votes.”

statement: The percentage of Americans with natural immunity from getting COVID-19 is “a very powerful vaccine in itself.”

statement: “No candidate has ever won both Florida and Ohio and lost.”

statement: “In Wisconsin, there are approximately 70,000 absentee ballots that do not have matching ballot applications as required by law.”

statement: “Actually, I won Wisconsin.”

statement: “No state in the country verifies United States citizenship as a condition for voting in federal elections.”

statement: “In certain swing states, there were more votes than people who voted, and in big numbers.”

statement: A 1993 example of voter fraud in Philadelphia is “exactly what happened to us” in the 2020 election.

statement: "Big victory moments ago in the State of Nevada. The all Democrat County Commissioner race, on same ballot as President, just thrown out because of large scale voter discrepancy."

statement: “They have 180 million people, families under what he wants to do, which will basically be socialized medicine — you won’t even have a choice — they want to terminate 180 million plans.”
